AllowCrossOriginAuthPrompt.title: Cross-origin HTTP Basic Auth prompts
AllowCrossOriginAuthPrompt.description: Controls whether third-party sub-content on a page is allowed to pop-up an HTTP Basic Auth dialog box. Typically this is disabled as a phishing defense. If this policy is not set, this is disabled and third-party sub-content will not be allowed to pop up a HTTP Basic Auth dialog box

AuthNegotiateDelegateByKdcPolicy.title: Use KDC policy to delegate credentials
AuthNegotiateDelegateByKdcPolicy.description: Controls whether approval by KDC policy is respected to decide whether to delegate Kerberos tickets

AuthNegotiateDelegateWhitelist.title: Kerberos delegation server whitelist
AuthNegotiateDelegateWhitelist.description: Servers that Google Chrome may delegate to. Separate multiple server names with commas. Wildcards (*) are allowed

AuthSchemes.title: Supported authentication schemes
AuthSchemes.description: Specifies which HTTP authentication schemes are supported by Google Chrome. Example: basic,digest,ntlm,negotiate

AuthServerWhitelist.title: Authentication server whitelist
AuthServerWhitelist.description: Specifies which servers should be whitelisted for integrated authentication. Integrated authentication is only enabled when Google Chrome receives an authentication challenge from a proxy or from a server which is in this permitted list. Separate multiple server names with commas. Wildcards (*) are allowed

DisableAuthNegotiateCnameLookup.title: Disable CNAME lookup when negotiating Kerberos authentication
DisableAuthNegotiateCnameLookup.description: Specifies whether the generated Kerberos SPN is based on the canonical DNS name or the original name entered.If you enable this setting, CNAME lookup will be skipped and the server name will be used as entered

EnableAuthNegotiatePort.title: Include non-standard port in Kerberos SPN
EnableAuthNegotiatePort.description: Specifies whether the generated Kerberos SPN should include a non-standard port. If you enable this setting, and a non-standard port (i.e., a port other than 80 or 443) is entered, it will be included in the generated Kerberos SPN

NtlmV2Enabled.title: Enable NTLMv2 authentication
NtlmV2Enabled.description: Controls whether NTLMv2 is enabled. All recent versions of Samba and Windows servers support NTLMv2. This should only be disabled for backwards compatibility and reduces the security of authentication
